channel.title: Memory Error/Virus
channel.description:
I didn't want to take this problem out to the public, so I decided to come to intelligent members.
My problem: I save all my new songs/files/other stuff onto my computer. Then I restart. The computer is back on, and it seems to have reverted to a spot back in time.
Anyone know how to solve it?
Don't suggest the following: --Get anti-virus: Most require restart (Unless you have a good one then post :)) --Google: Nothing what-so-ever
I have Microsoft Windows XP Home Edition.
Thanks, xSignal

item.title: Memory Error/Virus
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

When I had spyware on my comp about 2 years ago. I got the spyware within a week of when I used the system restore. When I restored back a month, I rebooted, and booted up the computer again, and I still had it. :\ Microsoft sucks. The only software that helped was Spybot.

Any way, if the above posts do not help, then you can always try my guide.

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

Hope you get your problem fixed. I hate getting spyware/viruses. Been completely clean of that stuff for about 2 years.

Edit: Spelling.

Read full topic

item.title: Memory Error/Virus
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

It all depends on exactly what you mean by “reverting back in time” - if I remember correctly, Windows System Restore isn’t supposed to affect your files. All I can offer without more details are some generic suggestions.

Program suggestions:
NOD for anti-virus. I like it a lot, does a very good job of saving you from careless mistakes (it’s got specialized modules for EVERYTHING).
You might also check out Spybot and Adaware, I’ve had some random little malwares do crazy things to my computer.

A few ways of getting around a file-losing reset:

  • Live CD
  • Install troubleshooting programs to a flash drive
  • Slave the hard drive to one with a functioning OS

Links:
NOD32 2.70.32 w/ fix (thank you SYI)
Spybot S&D
Ubuntu (Dapper Live ISO)

Read full topic

item.title: Memory Error/Virus
item.dc:creator: @RancidKraut RancidKraut
item.description:
@RancidKraut wrote:

Do you have System Restore enabled? Or some kind of “recovery console?” Maybe they’re glitching.

Read full topic
